newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Securities Clearing in pilot individual accts.
newsitem.headline: HK Securities Clearing in pilot individual accts.

text.p: The Hong Kong Securities Clearing Co Ltd said on Tuesday it planned to start a pilot scheme admitting 1,000 investor account holders into the Central Clearing And Settlement System (CCASS).
The scheme would allow a gradual adaptation of a proposed project to allow investors to open direct investor accounts in CCASS, it said in a statement.
Currently, only brokers, custodians and other intermediaries through whom investors deal can participate in CCAS.

Investor participation in CCASS would give them control over the movement of their shares in CCASS, provision of evidence of their shareholdings in CCASS and receipt of corporate information directly from listed issuers, it said.
The project would also give better legal protection of investors' interests in securities deposited in CCASS, the clearing company said.
But investors' accounts were basically a depositary account, and trade settlements would still need to go through CCASS broker participants, it added.
The introduction of the project was followed by positive responses to market consultation and investors' surveys conducted by the company in the first quarter of 1997, it added.
The company said it would take 12 to 15 months to implement the project.
